Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice or Type B kantharos; discoloured white slip; interior glazed streaky black; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The number '82' is written in pencil on the inside of the sherd. A paper label is glued on the inner surface, over the join, with the number '6' written in pencil; '6' is also written on the exterior. The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic details and the absence of decoration on interior and exterior surfaces make it impossible to determine whether it comes from a kantharos or a chalice. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior; given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) also have very little decoration.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1456) (phase 2)
